primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The universal human intuition of life after death (the 'rumor') is validated and transformed into historical certainty through the resurrection of Jesus.

tekstueel_bewijs: One who had died was no longer dead

object.identificatie: Victory over Death / Confirmation of Hope
tekstueel_bewijs: The grandest news the world has ever heard
If God be God and truth be truth
In this rumor of life we all have a stake
We have now a hope in Jesus

helper.identificatie: The Women / The Disciples / Nature / Cultural Traditions
tekstueel_bewijs: some women brought to those who mourned
Plants and flowers repeat the rumor
Philosophy, religion, and ethics bring their testimony
The grave which lies at the end of the road
The grasshopper shall be a burden
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Death is presented as an inescapable, biological, and ontological reality that affects all of creation, requiring a divine intervention.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical struggle for justice and decent living as a response to the hope of immortality.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / Christian People
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Ethical action is presented as a 'prostitution' if it replaces hope, but a necessary fruit of believing that humans are immortal souls.

voorbeelden_mens_subject: We never halt till we stumble into the grave
We must fight for what is right

voorbeelden: Fight for what is right we must
The notion of life being stronger than death is an old one
We all wonder if this be all
I know that my redeemer liveth
The rumor had not passed beyond hearsay
One who had died was no longer dead

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of God to overcome the 'Inability' of man facing death. It is a sermon of divine capability.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From ~S1 (Rumor) through S2 (The reality of the grave/Ecclesiastes) to S1 (The Fact of Resurrection).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension between the 'Rumor' and the 'Grave' is resolved by the historical 'Actuality' of the Risen Christ.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The description of physical decay in Ecclesiastes 12 is given significant weight.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. While it acknowledges human effort, the 'engine' of the story is God's action in the resurrection, which humans merely receive and witness.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Christian people are far and away ahead in trying to live decent lives... set good examples

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the Resurrection
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He is risen... God took him

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Human as passive receiver of life
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: The grandest news... is now confirmed by the risen Lord

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Job or the women are witnesses/receivers, not models of performance.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The women are messengers of an act they did not perform.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Comfort and hope in the face of mortality.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is monergistic; God acts, man hears and believes.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the 'universal rumor' to the 'specific gospel' is logically and narratively sound.
spanning_punten: The shift from the 'decent lives' of Christians back to the 'helplessness' of the dying man.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'word' or 'rumor' acts as the external means of grace.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Death is the primary 'opponent' rather than personal guilt.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God/Christ as the Subject of the primary salvific action. The hearer is correctly positioned as the Receiver of a 'rumor' that becomes 'fact'.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly heavy on Devoir (Must) in the middle section regarding justice.
modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Ensure the 'Must' of justice is clearly rooted in the 'Can' of the Resurrection.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly state that we fight for justice *because* the Risen Christ has already claimed the world.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Strongly portrayed through the imagery of Ecclesiastes.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful example of a theocentric sermon that uses human experience as a bridge to divine action without falling into moralism.

comparatiele_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorical analysis would focus on the evocative imagery of the 'grasshopper'; Greimassian analysis shows this imagery serves to establish the 'Opponent' (Death) to necessitate the 'Subject' (Christ).
comparatiele_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis would focus on the meaning of Ecclesiastes 12; this analysis focuses on how the preacher uses that text to move the hearer from 'Subject of their own life' to 'Receiver of God's life'.
comparatiele_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Rumor' functions as a 'Helper' that prepares the 'Receiver' for the 'Object' (Resurrection).

appendices.notities: The sermon uses a 'Subject-Switch' where the human subject (trying to live/burying dead) is replaced by the Divine Subject (raising the dead) at the climax.
